title: "I think we tunnel visioned too much on uniqueness at the expense of some aspects of game health"
body:
>Both Kalista and Azir are representative of a period where in hindsight I think we tunnel visioned too much on uniqueness at the expense of some aspects of game health (overloaded kits) and skill floors. That's resulted in some champs who have really cool stuff on their kits, but have been challenges to balance for regular play versus top tier play. My take is that there are solid concepts there, but that the execution on them needs some work (reducing unnecessary strengths primarily, and putting that power into other parts of the kit, giving clearer weaknesses to play around).

-Meddler

Adding on to this.

Kalista's hop mechanic combines two fundamental elements of the game, for free and on a fraction of a second cool down, on the type of champion that abuses both of those mechanics the most. Moving normally stutters auto attacks and auto attacks stutter moving; by overwriting the weakness in those fundamental mechanics of the game interacting, Kalista's passive was _broken_. It doesn't matter if they balance it to be weak, it literally breaks entire mechanics of the game.

Camille on the other hand does exceedingly little if at all to really break the game. As far as I'm concerned, other than some odd but easily fixable interactions with her ultimate (please let it go away if she dies), everything she does can be explained as a fundamental mechanic of the game working as intended.

Well, it is what people have suggested for J4's ult to be able to do for years now. Given how her kit works, it feels perfectly fine to me. Even in a teamplay setting it sounds fine, because it gives you some way to nullify the enemy's mobility. And you might say "Well that's not fair because they rely on that mobility to survive." That's the risk of a team game with unique characters - you absolutely run the risk of your strength becoming a liability in certain situations. Whether it's Camille's grounding preventing the mobile from escaping, for example, or Riki's backstab backfiring spectacularly against Bristleback, and so on.

Honestly it is worse than what people were asking for as J4's ult.  People wanted J4's ult to still do damage, trap you in a small area, and ground you preventing all mobility/flash meaning you can't escape.  Camilles ult is much larger, has no upfront damage meaning most of it's power is vs tanks not squishies due to the %health damage on autos, has less range, and you can still use mobility spells/summoners in it.

Honestly Camille ult is strong, but not more so than half a dozen other ults I could name.  It also has a lot of weaknesses like sudo trapping Camille because if she leaves the ult ends as well as pushing away other enemies, making her actually be a bad pick on wombo combo teams.  

I don't think it even needs to be nerfed, as the rest of her kit is nerfed it will get toned down at the same time because it's power relies on Camille having power in her basic abilities.  In terms of combat power it is actually pretty weak, so as her kit gets nerfed it will be nerfed since it is only effective if you want to stay in the same area as an enemy.

I think with all the hyper mobile champions now in league, it is about time some champions have skill that pre-empt mobility abuse _without _ disconnecting the other guy's keyboard.

Azir/Kalista needed to have a high skill floor/ceiling because of how powerful they are comparative to the standard league character. When they're weak, you have a difficult-to-play character (For the average person) who does worse/on-par with easy characters. There's no reason to pick him/her other than flavor.

Camille, comparatively, isn't the least bit difficult to play. She's straight-forward and the hardest parts about her kit are timing her Q to get the true damage and hitting the edge of your sweep. There's nothing comparative to Azir's shurima shuffle or Kalista's spear-shuffling. She's VERY straight-forward comparative to them. Even if you nerf her, she's going to be pickable because she still has utility (Lockdown ult) and isn't so hard as to handicap new players.
